The people working here and visiting could not be more friendly. I have visited at least 75 different places in the last year and this place has the best neighborhood feeling by a mile. I love good wings and no other place satisfied me like this place. I met the owner today and he bought me and the guy next to me a beer. Can't wait to go back and try the beef on weck (these guys are true New Yorker's and know how to cook. If you happen to be a Buffalo Bills fan (I'm sorry) this place is for you. I highly recommend giving this place a chance.

Once i heard there was a restaurant called Lebowski's, the next day my special lady friend and i made the trip. It's hard to give an objective review for two reasons. First, i've always loved "The Big Lebowski" and love a good (or even a cheaply made ones at home) White Russian. Second, just before we got our food, a parade of douschery took over the patio area.  You know the kind of people that are just annoying unless it is you and your friends, then they actually seem funny and fun.  The patio area is nice with a good amount of seating and cornhole and some bowling pin game i didn't get to check out. It seems like the cornhole cramped the area a little bit once the patio got the big crowd and maybe should be put up until after dinnertime.   The Lebowski Caucasian was pretty good, but i can't say i would pay $9 again for it. i believe i saw $2 Coronas for the months of April and May.   i can't say the food was outstanding, the wings were good, but not the best. The Buffalo beef on weck was better than the wings and would definitely be my recommendation. I had never had it before, It is really just a "roast beef sandwich on a salty kummelweck roll." i do love pretzel salt and bbq so i would probably get that again with some beer.   We liked our server although we could have used him mid-meal for some additional bbq sauce.

Decent burgers and fries. We had a to go order so maybe not as good due to that but everything was average. The atmosphere looked good inside but obviously didn't stay.   Updated this to reflect 4, after a second visit. We decided to try it again because we were craving wings and they were said to have great wings and they were right. The wings were fantastic. We got the buffalo and gold rush and they were huge. If this was my first experience I would have said 5 stars but because if the take out order we had I split the difference.

This place is amazing.  Atmosphere and wait staff are top notch.  The best part is, they are open late and the nighttime menu is excellent.  Try the spinach artichoke dip, and of course the garlic fries!

Lebowski's is a great neighborhood bar/grill with food that stands far above what these places normally serve.  The standout: Beef on Weck.  This Buffalo-based sandwich has yet to go national on a large scale, but, if this is a typical version, a French dip will never be the same.  Basically this is a warm roast beef sandwich whose highlight is the roll:  a salted kaiser roll with caraway seeds.  Possible toppings include traditional dip sauce, pure horseradish, creamy horseradish, mustard sauce etc.  They have many other interesting sandwiches but our short trip to Charlotte meant we couldn't sample them all.  However, we were able to order "slider" versions of their sandwiches which is basically 2 or 3 mini versions of their popular sandwiches.  All were excellent but the beef on weck make this a destination.

I love the food here, I am a huge fan.  Their wings are usually my go to choice of food here they are among my favorite wings in Charlotte. I got some sweet potato tots with them that had a delicious dipping  sauce. I have also had some of the sliders as well as a couple roast beef sandwiches all delicious.  If in the mood to sit outside they also have a great patio on which I sat the last time I came here on Wednesday which you get 10 wings for $6 and also $3 mystery beer night. I had the gold rush and the stingers for the wing flavors and I believe I like the gold rush a tad more. But a friend told me recently to try the Blackened wings add buffalo, so pumped for that on my next visit.  Their white russians here are also very tasty and better yet this place is named after and themed to one fantastic movie: The Big Lebowski.   "Yeah, well, you know, that's just, like, your opinion, man." -- The Dude

Came for the wings...duh. Fantastic! My family is from Rochester MY, so I have definitely gone and had real Buffalo wings from the source. It's been impossible to replicate down south...but these. These are damn close. Good prices, great service. We brought our dog who we also usually order food for (I know. it's absurd. We are those people.)...and I was going to pay for an entire kids meal or something and they offered a better solution since I guess we aren't the only crazy customers who do this. The food was even served in a dog bowl!! I did not request that but she loved it! I hope the chef doesn't get offended by cooking for a dog because we thought every thing was fantastic and it just added to our experience. Thank you Lebowskis!

I absolutely LOVE this place! I feel like I am at home here, such a cozy little spot! Food is GREAT! I have never ordered anything I didn't like - I enjoy the fact that many of the dishes have a home style flare to them. BEST WINGS IN CHARLOTTE! Hands down - try the Carolina Gold - you will LOVE Them.   I work for a nonprofit organization and Lebowskis has been very helpful to us, allowing us to host events there and providing apps for our clients. This is a family run business and this family is TOP NOTCH. Good people.   My husband and I love this place so much we had our rehearsal dinner on the patio this spring.   Check them out - you won't be disappointed!

My all time favorite cheat meal ~ a good old fashioned #cheeseburger & fries!  This is my first time Lebowski's Grill & their burger did not disappoint! And thx to Yelp, I got free garlic fries, just for checking in!
If you're going for a Buffalo experience it's a 5-star. If your just out and about CLT it's a 3-star. We were a mix of people so we gave it 4-stars.

As the name says, it is indeed your neighborhood grill. The wait time wasn't long on a Friday evening and the place even though looks small has enough tables for a lot of people. Stepping inside you already get a feeling of a friendly make-yourself-at-home atmosphere and not like a chain restaurant. It is one of those places where you could order a drink and a meal, get nostalgic and talk for hours with your friends. Our waitress was friendly but did seem a bit anxious about getting orders right. I got the burger with a side of homemade chilli. The turn around time was quick and the burger tasted okay but not the best. I may have to come back here and try out a different dish. The restaurant is laid back and friendly, yes I would recommend!
Being a Buffalo native, I love Lebowski's! The food is good and well priced and the atmosphere is awesome. One of my favorite movies is the Big Lebowski!

Lebowski's is my favorite bar in the Dilworth area. It's what I like to call a "feel good" bar. They have really good bar food - you can't go wrong with the apps, wraps, sandwiches, or wings and they also have a solid beer selection. I've always had great service here. There are plenty of tv's to watch the game and they have a nice dog friendly patio. This place has a great atmosphere for all.
Decent food. I went here with a few friends the other night and ordered their world famous wings and fried fish. It was good but not world famous...

Charlotte has some very heavy competition when it comes to wings.  Go ahead and Google "Best wings in Charlotte", and most every site will have Lebowski's listed towards the top.   In my quest to hit every wing joint in CLT, I finally found myself on that side of town.   I wanted to see if the hype was real, I wanted to confirm what other Yelp reviewers had confirmed, that this was one of the Wing Mecca's of CLT.     So 3 star is for service, both my wife and my orders came out wrong and getting the server back to rectify the issue was a chore.  They were not that busy, so I am a little confused as to where the server vanished too.    My wife ordered the Buffalo Chicken wrap, but  instead of Buffalo sauce, she asked for the Stinger sauce (sweet heat) - the dish came out with neither sauces.  Also, why is there an up charge on this dish for fries?   Chips suck.  $1.29 up-charge is ridiculous.   Kudos to them for having a Yelp check-in offer that covers the cost.   But really, chips?    My gripe is I ordered wings with blue cheese and it was served with no blue cheese.   I know right?  Come on......I also ordered my fries tossed in the Garlic-Parm dry rub, that was missed too.     I went with the Buffalo Trifecta.......  But I really was here for Wings!!!!!  Okay, better than average.   Are they top ten, possible.   Are they top five, I could make a pretty strong argument that there are better wing spots.   But, in my view, as a true wing connoisseur, I find it baffling that they only offer six flavors.  Maybe they feel they have "dialed in" the basic flavors?   I dunno.  I went with the Garlic-Parm.   The dry rub was excellent, the wings perfectly cooked, not over crispy.     Just to confirm, the WINGS ARE EXCELLENT.   It was just not as earth shattering, to die for - I gotta drive all the way back to this spot to get my wing-on perfection.  A few other random comments for you, if you even read this far down:  The Haddock fish is fabulous, I would go there again and get this as a main dish.   Many reviewers have Yelped about the Haddock, my stamp of approval, white flaky with a perfectly lightly battered breading that is not fishy tasting one bit.   As of matter of fact, I was just in London for a week, and Lebowski's can hang with any of the Brits Fish n Chips.  Again, as many of the Yelpers commented, the Beef on Weck was tasteless.   I found it ultra bland.  There are better choices on the menu, just saying.  French fries are very good.  Ultra crispy.   Yum...   Great choice of local craft beers, six taps with two rotating.  It is definitely a cool, really great place to relax with friends.

Interesting place, they have a whole section of the menu dedicated to speciality white russians. I had the Lebowski burger with garlic fries. Burger was fine overall with the exception of the grainy and somewhat off-putting  "queso sauce". Fries were really good, had that nice double fried crunch. Overall pretty standard fare from this neighborhood Buffalo bar.

Lebowski s...... I have been visiting this place for more than 5 years now, is a local neighborhood place, that can beat any of the american food chain in Charlotte. The hamburgers and chicken wings are amazingly well prepared, don t despite other items in their menu. The crew is very friendly and they will make your eating experience a pleasant one. Totally recommended, if you want to  experience the local american flavors

Lebowski's is one of those restaurants where I always think about switching up my order and not getting the same thing every time.  But then I remember how good the beef on weck sandwich is, and I order it again and again and again.    They piled your weck roll high with thin sliced, already dipped in au jus roast beef.  (They'll give you more au jus for .49 cents extra, you don't reallllly need it, but I always get it anyway).  The employees are usually very friendly.  Last night we were seated inside, but right next to the patio door.  Every time the door opened you could smell someone's cigarette, when we asked to move the hostess was happy to accommodate us, and we slid over a few tables.  This place is a great neighborhood stop for lunch or dinner.

The only reason they don't have 5 stars is because I'm a hard core dolphins fan and didn't realize how serious of a bills fan stop this was.   First off, the Chilli Mac n Cheese alone makes it worth stopping here. Unique local beer options at a pretty reasonable price.   The roast beef sandwich dipped in the au jus sauce and horsey sauce was amazing! So tender and the wek bun soft and warm.   The haddock has such a good flavor to it and the perfect amount of crispy.

Lebowskis is known for there wings but I like their burgers. I ordered a medium burger and got a medium well burger. Ok. I can handle that. It was also a little salty, but I can handle that too. My biggest beef with lebowskis is this. We chose to sit outside, because inside didn't have room for a table for 5. They don't have a sctrict enough policy on dogs. There where 3 dogs in this area and all of them where  barking and being very Annoying. They offered water bowls so there was a dog 2 feet away from us sloppily drinking water and shaking water everywhere. It is pretty gross. I mean this doesn't change my rating. They are still really good. But the dogs where a nuisance to everybody who didn't have the dog. And then parking. ABHORENT parking. There are about 15 spaces and only one exit/entrance that has parallel parking where another lane would go. So it is just one lane in and out. The service was great and the food was pretty good too. Im not saying I wouldn't return, but I would return more often if these things where fixed eventually.

After a few more trips to Lebowski's, I've gotta up my stars to five. The atmosphere is cozy and fun, the food is way better than typical bar food, and the service is pretty much on-point. Throw in some crazy cheap prices, and Lebowksi's is knocking it out of the park.

Favorite restaurant in Charlotte!  Absolutely obsessed with this place.  Best wings ever (buffalo, extra crispy) and garlic fries - my order every time.  I won't order wings anywhere else.  I've had bites of other items and they're amazing too.  The Lebowski Caucasian is my favorite white russian on the menu.  I can't believe more people don't know about this place.

Great place to watch a game, grab some grub, hang with friends and play trivia. The wings are solid and the garlic fries are great. Make sure to ask them about their daily drink specials. This is considered the Charlotte Buffalo Bills bar for any Bills fans out there.

I don't know why I've never written a review expressing our love for this restaurant!  We've been coming here since they opened, and, although we don't go out to eat very often, this is our go-to place for special events when we want to have a good time, eat good food, get great service and relax.  I usually get a fish plate, or the chicken wings, which are some of the BEST in Charlotte!  The Burgers are of course delicious, and the plates are plentiful.  They have a good selection of draft beers and a full bar with a variety of signature drinks.  It's just a great place all the way around and we hope it sticks around for a long time.

The Jerk Burger never disappoints, it's my go-to here!  Fries fresh and fried to perfect crispness. The wings, salads and haddock fish plate also on point .  What I love about this place is it's unpretentious neighborhood hangout vibe and awesome service   What more could you ask for ? *****

Love this place..just had fish tacos for lunch. I should have written this review a long time ago, as it's become quite a regular spot for me.   While many assume it's a pun on the movie, it's really a Buffalonian's Hot Spot at heart. Featuring wings, beef on wecks, and haddock fish fry, you would most likely get the same response from anyone that's from upstate NY, Lebowski's is where it's at! I'm not from Buffalo, so I speak only on hear say from other folks I've met around CLT. Growing up here in Charlotte, I must say they rank among the top of my favorite Chicken Wing spots. That Jerkiyaki is off the charts. For the vegetarians out there, they actually have some great veggie options as well, and their Mission Bay Salad (I add haddock) is ridiculous.   Yes the Dude Abides! They do play a little off of the movie featuring The Dude, for all you Big Lebowski lovers. You'll find several movie references mixed in with the Buffalo decor and fan fare. With several specialty White Russians, this place a must if you like a good Caucasion to sip on. Great beer options as well, both local and national craft options, along with all your standards.  Staff is laid back, but personable and helpful if you need any suggestions. There is a lot to choose from on the menu.

I went here on Monday, Jan. 6, 2014 with my Groupon deal.  It was kind of slow and not as spacious.  I tried Sicilian wings, a salad and a sandwich.  The Sicilian chicken wings were different but the taste was not as I pictured.  I will give them 5 points for the salad and presentation.  The sandwich will be an acquired taste.  Overall, I would go back again to watch the game.

Good food , horrible service, and it's freezing inside!!! Super excited about grabbing a bite to eat at the local tavern and waited forever after asking a minute to look over the menu.......worse mistake ever. Hopefully won't have to be an option anymore on east Blvd.

Cute and cozy neighborhood restaurant in downtown Charlotte. I loved the atmosphere, and the fried pickles were great. I had high expectations for the fried haddock based on previous reviews and marked as a house favorite-it was good, not amazing. Maybe the breading wasn't my favorite? I couldn't really put my finger on it. The garlic fries were also pretty good, and the boneless medium wings were spicier than expected (but still tasty). The coleslaw however, I hated. The vinegar was really strong in it, and to be fair, I'm hard to please with coleslaw to begin with. Overall I would still come back to try other foods. The staff was friendly and attentive. Wish there were half stars to bump up this rating a little more.
Several visits here. A solid beer selection and 1/2 price wings on Wed. They also do a mystery beer thing on Wed. You pick the genre and they bring you a surprise.

As my dukedom would indicate, I'm a fan of this place.   I'll try to get through this entire review without dropping any cheesy Big Lebowski references....Well, okay, maybe a couple.   My favorite night to come here is on Wednesday night, as they have half priced wings & a "mystery" craft beer special. It's a great way to inexpensively sample your way through the wing combos, and taste a few unique brews along the way; I've definitely stumbled upon some really great beers this way. I wouldn't think that you MUST order a White Russian while you're here, but if you do--they are on special for a reduced price as well . Personally, I'm not much of a fan of the caucasian...but you know, that's just like, my opinion man.   As for the other menu items besides the (oh so delicious) wings, Lebowski's serves up an array of bar food from the Upstate NY region. I'm talkin' Beef on Weck, White Hots, Fish Fry...you get my drift. I'm sure you can definitely come in here on Sunday, watch the Bills lose, drown your sorrows in massive amounts of Blue Light & Genny Cream Ale, and talk about where you were when Frank Reich led the comeback against the Oilers.   So, if this all sounds like fun (and it should), you should definitely check them out. FYI, the parking lot can fill up in a hurry, so just be prepared to find a spot down the street if you can't get in their actual lot.

As a born and raised upstate New York girl, and a recent transplant to Charlotte, I was overjoyed when I heard about this place!  I went with my roommate, and introduced her to some of the food I grew up on!  I chose the "Taste of Buffalo" to get a taste of it all.  It included wings, a haddock fish fry (the only fish to fry in my opinion) and a beef on weck slider as well as french fries.  As an extremely picky wing eater, I have to say that the wings reminded me of home...I opted for just "hot" which is classic for Buffalo.  The fish was on the smaller side, but was tasty, and they have it every night, unlike at home (usually Fridays only).  The beef on weck was also delish.  Only downfall- we had a coupon but found out it was only valid on certain nights.  Lots of Buffalo Bills stuff inside....felt like home!    My rommate got some sort of sandwich, and also really enjoyed it.  There was a dip on the menu called "The Fredonia."  My sister went to school at Fredonia, so I took a picture of it on the menu and sent it to her!  She got a kick out of it for sure!  If you are an upstater, as a lot of we are in Charlotte, check it out, I don't think you will be disspointed!

Lebowski's has earned another star :-)  When you walk in, the decor is so basic and homey. There are certainly no frills at this place, but the food is great. Staff is cool and the whole vibe is just so laid back. It is all table seating (+ of course the small bar) & the dining area is very open.  ...This time I had a Greek salad w/ grilled chicken. It was humongous and sooo good. Sometimes when a place throws some chicken on a salad, the chicken is so bland, as if just for the sake of having it on there. Here though, the chicken actually had flavor.  I also had some of the Trio Dip Platter and it was equally de-lish. (And) very well could have served as the entree.  This is the type of place where you wanna get what you had the last time because it was so good, but then again wanna try something else because it all looks so appetizing.  Here, I would say it is pretty safe to experiment a bit. They seem to know what they are doing and aren't stingy about it either!
Extremely friendly staff!  Excellent service and a great meal!  Who could ask for more?  My favorite meal is beef on weck w au jus...always tasty!

Went during prime dinner time hour on a Saturday evening and was pleasantly surprised at the lack of wait. We were seated immediately in the patio area, which was lovely because the weather was very agreeable, i.e. not ridic humid and hot. Our drink orders were taken immediately, but the waitress took forever getting back to us for our meal orders. Had to wait another eternity (or what felt like eternity because I was starving) for the food to come. Had the garden burger veracruz style with a side of mac n cheese. Burger was not bad but not super memorable because I was already on the verge of forgetting I had eaten it the moment I finished devouring it. Mac n cheese was nothing special either, but plus points for using curly macaroni that held in more cheese than elbow mac. My friend got their "Legendary Wings" and thought they were delicious, but not legendary. Not a place I'd have cravings for, but still a solid neighborhood bar.
We love take- out at Lebowski since we have kids. We love the Kenmore special on Fri nights with haddock, wings, fries for 12.95 We love mild, stinger, and gold rush flavored wings. Nice people!

Good food. Good service. Seems a bit over rated as I think 3 stars is deserved. If you've never been then certainly pay them a visit. Decent beer selection and varied menu in a pretty laid back setting. We had the beef on weck, beef and provolone sandwich, and BBQ sandwich --- nothing special but not bad. Fries were not to our liking, tater tots were yummy, Mac n cheese was OK. 3 solid stars.

UYE @Lebowski's 10/18/2009;      If you look at the name Lebowski's " Grill and Pub " its very deceiving....   I bet within a 1 mile radius  there is( Dave help me out) 30 or more places that  A)Serve Food B) Serve drinks and or combination of both so I guess it comes down to this.        If your going out to have a meal why settle for food that is not cooked  basically reheated ?  Diners want quality not something that was driven or flown half way across the county  just so it can make it to your plate! If you haven't been to Lebowski's for a meal or appetizers the last time you " Go" to where ever you "Go" just ask as I did and the taste tells " what is actually cooked?" .Then they will be glad to have you as a " regular" at Lebowsk'is!         If it's Spirits that your out for when was the last time you visited your " Favorite Place" and did not have something to eat? So we are back at square one.Why lower your expectations of the food just because, your having Drinks?You should not have too!!         When you go to Lebowski's you will learn very  very quickly as did our group of YELPERS  that this is a place that we will return to...

We got to restaurant at a busy time and was seated promptly outside. The atmosphere was cozy, we came with 2 children and our table was too small. We received our drinks quickly but had to wait 15 min to place our order but it was 8 on a Saturday evening so that was fine. After receiving someone else's food from a food runner we finally received our wings and the our meal. The wings were very good, the side salad was good, and all of our meals were delicious actually. My husband and I alone may return here due to the food being very good and they had a good beer selection but we will not be taking our children again. My sons kid meal was $10.25 2 sliders and apples. My daughters grilled cheese and fries was $7.75 that's including their $2.25 charge for drinks. My 7 year old could have eaten at Capital Grill for a lower price. There again great Grill restaurant but not affordable to take children.
We both had the Angus burger patty with salad and it was great.  The burgers were cooked well and very tasty.   Had the charbroiled taste...excellent.
Went here with my wife of Friday and I was blown away by their wings, food is great, turkey slider I recomend. Definitely  going back soon.

We went with a group of 8. It was trivia night (score!) which is always a good time. However, the only cheery staff member there seemed to be the guy running the Trivia night... the rest of the servers acted like being at Lebowskis was the last thing they wanted to do, were incredibly slow, and ... just didn't smile. I mean, a smile goes a LONG way is all I'm saying.  On to the food!  I'm a wing junkie so naturally we ordered some wings for appetizers. And of course, a round of drinks. Our drinks arrived much later than they should have considering we were right next to the bar and everyone was focused on the trivia... We were really hungry and really looking forward to those carolina gold and hot wings that... never arrived. Our burgers showed up first.   I ordered the Jerk Style Burger with onions, very very tastey! I had never tried anything like it and there wasn't a crumb left. This burger has won awards, you should try it!  Back to the wings--we were told there was a "communication error" with the computers and the kitchen never got our wing order. They would be "right out." We informed our server (again) that those were appetizers and our meal was already here. We weren't impressed and let him know. Our wings came out, and were comped. They were delicious and ended up being dessert for the crew.  In short--the food was great but the service was... not enthusiastic or speedy by any means. I'll definitely go back, but I expect better service, Lebowskis!

Like the movie from which this bar takes it's nominal inspiration, Lebowski's is fun, quirky and surprisingly substantial. It's a neighborhood bar, where you can easily feel like a regular on your first visit. The staff is friendly and attentive, even when the small dining area is packed.  The menu consists of typical bar fair.  They don't try to elevate it, or reinterpret it.. Just do it really well. The wings are said to be the best in Charlotte, which I can't argue.. They are really good wings. I enjoy the Carolina Gold Rush, a mustard-based sauce.    There seems to be drink specials every day.. At least there have been every time I visit. My favorite is Mystery Beer Monday: you tell the bartender what you like and he/she will pick something for you. What a great way to try new brews?!  The Lebowski inspired artwork livens the environment. If only there was a bowling alley!

THE DUDE is in town!  I love going to this place.  The décor is amazing if you like The Big Lebowski.  I try to buy the John Goodman pixel painting but it's a staple to the restaurant.  They have many different varieties of things to order whether for lunch or dinner.  I usually go with the three sliders so I can have a different taste of multiple things.  My wife usually gets the fish and fries and douses them in vinegar.  They are excellent!  It's not a very big place but if you go at the right times you shouldn't have that long of a wait.

Amazing Bar & Grill with incredible food for a bar atmosphere. This is one of my favorite places to go in Charlotte on any night of the week there are specials to be had. Trivia on Tuesday is always fun and is an ideal spot for both a low key dinner but also an excellent nightlife location! I highly recommend Lebowski's!

Lebowski or should I say Lee- average?  Service here is like an old, coal freight train, at first wasn't getting any traction.  We weren't even noticed, we sat in the corner like an neglected red headed step child.  But, once we were noticed, the service started rolling at a steady pace.  The atmosphere was comfortable like any basic neighborhood bar.  The outside patio, is outside.  The place needs more TVs and although regulars and locals go here, it felt a little bit congested inside.  It had a nice rug that tied the room together.    All of the food were spin offs from the movie for the most part.  However, I chose the Jerk style burger and like honest Abe, I can't tell a lie.  It was wicked good.  The jerkiyaki glaze, pineapple and pepper- jack was more on point than a German Short-hair.  I don't know if it's because I ask for a medium cooked burger or if it was from all of the sauce but the bun was a little soggy like a Cherri-o left in a cereal bowl.  But I ate every bite. Take note, the chips are from a bag you'd find in a pantry and not housemade.  Lastly the White Russian.  Oh the White Russian.  Like a keystone in an arch, without the White Russian to lean on, this place would crumble.  But my God, the White Russian here are something out of a dream.  The Dude would be impressed and proud.  Best White Russian I have ever had and best in Charlotte.  I recommend going here strictly to try it.  Overall, Lebowski's is a very chill, easy- going, laid back, average, neighborhood bar.  Probably won't change ever and everyone is happy the way it is.  I recommend going there with the boys for a burger and of course a While Russian.  But if you are trying to watch a game, not the best option.   Once the service gets started, it's not half bad.  Thanks for the White Russians Lebowski's.

Note to people that have expense reports!!!  They PRINT THE DETAIL OF THE CHECK ON EVERY CREDIT CARD RECEIPT COPY.  If you travel for work, you need to know this, AND I WISH I KNEW THIS BEFORE I ORDERED. I have never had this problem in any other restaurant, anywhere, and I travel weekly.   The place is cozy, and the menu selections are numerous.   Lots of TV's = good views from every seat in the place.   I had a beef on weck with added cheese and horseradish. I think it was called a Franciscan. I was pretty good, but I think I would order something else next time.   The Mac and Cheese with bacon was really good!  Beer selection is extensive, and red wine by the glass is 8 bucks, with several good choices.   The service was friendly, but it was pretty relaxed. If it was lunchtime, I would have dinged them for it, but it was just fine with me as I wanted to watch a few sporting events.   Next time I will try their wings, as other reviewers said they were great.

Swung in for a Saturday night dinner and the host had us seated in less than 10 mins. Quick peruse of the menu and decided to go with the "Buffalo Trifecta" and was not disappointed by the platter of 6 wings, a beef slider, and two pieces of white fish along with fries was more than enough to get my fill (and in reality could probs be split for two). The entire plate was good but will say the buffalo wings stood out as being exceptional to the rest.  2¢- Saturday is $2 BL bottles  which paired perfectly with the setting and dinner

Cool little neighborhood bar.  Went there to watch part of a football game.  We were quickly greeted and sat on the patio.   We were offered water but that was the last we saw of our server for a while.  We decided on our food but she never came back.  We placed the menus on the table- maybe she thought we were still deciding.  We stacked the menus on top of each other- never saw her.  Eventually, we had to grab someone, anyone, to take our order. I had a burger (jerk style I think).  It was great.  I could have eaten 2 or 3 of them.  Someone else had the wings- they looked great and I'll be ordering them next time.  Other than waiting for what seemed like forever to place my order, I had a good experience here.  The food was good and they had a nice selection.  I will return to this place in the future.

I met my friend for lunch here with a Creative Loafing Deal and was pleasantly surprised to see that it was quite crowded! The menu had a variety of yumminess and I opted for a side salad and the French dip.  Oh wow! Again, happily surprised! My friend ordered a buffalo chicken wrap and it was also delicious.  The CLT deal cost $7.50 and paid for our whole meal (worth $25) so it was one of the least expensive and best lunches I've had in Dilworth!  The service was prompt and attentive..... A definite Keeper for a speedy and filling lunch!
Always good food and service.  Excellent fish and chips.

Where have I been? I Lebowski's is now one of my favorite places to grab a bite! I've heard a lot about them and seen them on east blvd but this is my 1st time eating there and I must say the wings are amazing and my chicken sandwich was a pleasant surprise and my wife fell in love with the cilantro lime salad dressing! I'm telling everyone I know!

Definitely one of my staples in Charlotte.  Their weekly specials are a hit! I love getting the haddock taco and the jerkiyaki wings.  All of their food is really delicious.  I come here pretty frequently, and we even went for new years eve.  It was perfect! Not a huge crowd, everyone was out partying the night away. I think they were gonna close early, but it was nice to still be able to go out and enjoy a quick bite to eat.  The fact that they are open later than most food spots in the area is perfect.  My go to for late night snacks. They also carry options from local breweries which is always nice.

Not my favorite.  I've been in twice now and each time I was really uninspired with the food I ordered.  It's pretty standard bar food but there was no wow factor.  The second time I went in was a total bummer.  I was strugglin' that day and just needed something delicious.  I ordered the nachos which arrived cold, as in the artificial cheese (like snack booth style) was COLD.  The server didn't really seem to care which didn't really help make matters any better.  Weak Sauce.

Lebowskis is my new favorite comfort place. I only wish I lived in walking distance. Very fresh vegetables can always be found in the salads. This last time I ordered the vegetable pita and it was fresh and just right. Lebowskis is perfect for late night food. Kyle is an excellent bartender, he made me feel welcome the first time I visited and recognized me the next visit. I feel very comfortable at Lebowskis.
Incredible. Service was on point. Prices are perfect. Food was amazing. I can't be more impressed with a small business in a big city. Hand on heart, new favorite place.

Hands down my favorite place on East Blvd (walking distance from my place) to grab great food and drinks with friends. The only bad thing I would say is, don't expect them to be able to accommodate large crowds without a reservation. But that's it! Best chicken wings and fries!

Servers were nice and attentive, the draft beer was tasty, and the trivia fun. Will return. I didn't eat anything this time, but i have in the past. I had the Beef on Weck and it was tasty. I would return again and try something different.

It was a beautiful day in Charlotte and I decided to take a walk up to East Blvd. and grab a bite to eat...so it was between Lebowski and its neighbor, they won... I ordered the Memphis with garlic fries. The sandwich was okay, perfectly grilled bread but the pulled pork was not as tender as I'd like, but the BBQ sauce was delicious, sweet with just enough tang to it, that and the garlic French fries were what earned them a 4 star! The fries were served fresh and hot and with a just right crunch and the perfect amount of seasoning.

Tried this restaurant while on business.  The folks I went with spoke very highly of the restaurant and said the best time to get there is before 12.  I tried their sliders and had the Beef on Weck; meatloaf sandwich; and honey butter chicken.  They were all very good and my favorites were the roast beef and honey butter chicken.  The roast beef was very moist and the honey butter chicken is just awesome!  I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant.

So good! I live in Dilworth but today was my first time at Lebowskis. I had the sliders and they were amazing! The turkey was my favorite though the chicken parm was delightful. Service was great.. Attentive and polite. Great place!
Food is always great, Thomas the bartender awesome, I come here often and don't plan on stopping anywhere else on east Blvd.

Went to lunch on New Year's Eve which likely was our hundredth time here.  Good as usual - beer is always good and we enjoy the turkey burger or Greek pita.  While the owners haven't said boo to us over the last couple of years, ever, Lizzy is our usual server and  we appreciate her remembering us and her wanting to be our server.  We come in to see her.  Unfortunately, she wasn't here this day.  Menu options are getting old and with new competition, we may not be as frequent dinners as we have in the past.

This place is a total neighborhood joint. A diehard buffalo bills bar, this place serves some of the best wings I've ever had in my life. The Gold rush and garlic parm wings are good but the Jerkiyaki are AMAZING.

Gave it another shot after receiving poor service one day and I'm thinking it was just a bad day. Service was much better. The food was good as always.   Love their garlic fries and beef in a Weck. Their buffalo chicken wrap is also great.  The atmosphere is family friend with a neighborhood appeal. Great place for lunch or casual  dinner.
Great food & a decent beer menu. My only complaint would be they need more room but again that is part of the charm of the place.
OMG the roast beef sandwich is amazing and the wings I think are the best in CLT. Be mindful this is a whole in the wall place, but really good food. Open late

Great food, low key vibe. Love this place. Great place for any Upstate New Yorker who resides in the Charlotte area to get some home style wings and bar food. Also, who can beat $2 Labatt's anytime down South?

Heard about this place recently, and seeing as how the owners are from my hometown - Buffalo, NY! - I had to try it! I was so excited to see familiar things on the menu like beef on weck , haddock fish fry and hot Buffalo wings! Let's just say I had all three. With a side of awesome fries.  SO good! The hot wings were really hot but good, not too salty. Just like we do in B-Lo! The fish was perfectly flaky and crispy. We visited on a Thursday night at about 10:00 and they were still going strong, not crowded, but not empty either.  I loved it and will definitely return.

We're from Buffalo. Not impressed at all with food. Wings just OK. Fish fry not up to par with original "Friday Fish Fry" found in Buffalo. Weck slider just OK. Garlic fries good. Biggest disappointment was that wings were ordered "extra extra" crispy and they were. not even crispy.  Won't be back.

Since the reviews of this place was all great, my husband and I decided to check it out. We almost missed it! The restaurant was EMPTY when we got there. At first when we passed, it seemed like they were closed. We walk in and they were eager to see us since we were their 1st customers of the night.....at 7pm.  The restaurant was is pretty small, but it felt comfortable. We get seated and put in our drink orders (and my drink was never empty! It would get down to about 3/4 full and our waitress would bring me a new one). We order the hummus dip as a starter and despite the fridge taste, it was pretty good. I like the flat bread better than the chips they serve.   I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap in a tortilla and blue cheese. As a side, I get the mac n cheese which was outstanding. My husband ordered the Beef on Weck. He didn't like the amount of salt that was on the bun, but he said overall it was very good. He also got the mac n cheese and that's all he would talk about. We split a spinach salad that had red onions and cranberries. This was a refreshing addition to our meal.  The only thing I didn't like is they didn't have the NFL network, instead they had NHL because the owners were from Buffalo, NY. I highly recommend anybody to stop by here, it's a great place to eat and have a few drinks.

I've been to Lebowski's a couple of times now. I've always had a nice meal here and sitting on the patio during warmer months is a great treat!  I've had a salad, their trio (had to try the famous beef on weck!), but the veggie panini is my favorite.  Beer selection is good, and the bartender let me try a new flavor before ordering a full glass (good thing, because I wasn't a fan and ordered my usual OMB Copper!).  Service is sometimes slow but the staff is friendly, and I'm happy to support this local, family-owned place.

You know, it's a great hangout with great tv's & a friendly (if somewhat, slow) staff.  Our server was good initially with some great beer recommendations (Long Board & Oberon).  We ordered and our beers came quickly enough, but we were more than halfway through our beers before we got our order, which was 1/2 an hour or more.  They weren't busy and we were turning around in our seats looking for a waitress for awhile.  Other servers noticed us looking around for her, but didn't say anything.    When she came past our table, she kind of stared at the table top... as if she realized she hadn't brought our food, or had forgotten to put it in.  They weren't busy at all.  We only ordered a Halibut Taco for me & a Chicken Taco for him.  The side that comes with it is nacho chips w/salsa, so it shouldn't have taken that long.  We got our second beers before we got our food.  That being said, she was friendly & apologized for the wait.  The tacos were really good.  Especially the Halibut one.  Big chunks of white fish, lightly, lightly crisped... it was almost like eating chunks of crab.  I really liked the chili-lime aioli...not too spicy or citrusy.  I'd definitely go back for that.  Oh, the food we were craving was hot dogs, which is why we chose Lebowski's.  They don't sell them anymore :(  The server said they were "Severs" (?) brand & Food Lion has them.  Ah well.

I'm a buffalonian so of course I cannot rate this place any less than a 5! Makes me feel right at home from the atmosphere to the food. Wings were pretty good for the south. I am very picky and could've been a little more crispy but the best I've had in Charlotte so far! I also had the beef on week slider. This was pretty good again for being in the south I'm just amazed at all they have it and obviously have had better in buffalo but I will take what I can get. For those that haven't had buffalo food this comes in a pretty good second! The service was also fantastic. I will say one bartender for a completely packed out place makes you worried but she was super attentive and did not make you wait for anything! Will 100% be back to this place!

We stopped here on a whim yesterday after my sons music class and boy am I glad we did!  Lebowski's would certainly make "The Dude" proud.  Laid back atmosphere with killer food.  Next time I'm wearing my robe...  Loved the Christmas lights lining the ceiling and carpet throughout the restaurant.  I ended up getting the Dixie Style burger adding Pimento cheese and a side of Mac and Cheese with Pecan Bacon.  Even though the burger wasn't the best I've had in Charlotte it was still really good.  The Pimento Cheese worked really well with the chili (how could it not?).  The Mac and Cheese was also really good - some of the best I've had.  The noodles were cooked just right (al dente) and the bacon to cheese ratio was just right.

This is a neighborhood bar with decent food. We started with the wings. They were good but not amazing. I was disappointed that they did not allow me to order all flats. Craving more buffalo action, I ordered the buffalo wrap. Skip the lettuce and add the fries. It was delicious and loaded with breaded chicken breast chunks and tomatoes and buffalo sauce. My friends enjoyed their dinners also and ordered the mystery beer special where the bartender selects the beer. It worked because they enjoyed the selection. I will be back to try other entrees.

We discovered Lebowski's Grill about 2 months ago and started becoming a regular to hear Jeff Brown, a talented local musician who plays here on Thursdays with an eclectic music selection, as well as his own stuff.  This definitely fits the bill for a neighborhood bar.  It's quite a cozy and friendly place.  The food here is excellent and they have quite a bit to offer for vegetarians.  I love the pimento & cheese burger which, like all of their burgers, can be made vegetarian.  The outdoor seating area is shaded and covered and a great spot to be on cooler evenings.  They have quite a few micro brews on tap, including the Charlotte-brewed OMB (Olde Mecklenburg Brewery), Two-Hearted Ale, and Fat Tire among others.  The owner is a music fan and you can see some of his extensive album collections on the walls.  The only addition is that they need a bike rack in the front.

Hmm maybe I'm just not used to a SUPER casual place, because this place has pretty decent reviews but for my opinion was a little disappointing. My husband though it was ok, the food and service was good.   This is what bothers me, cleanliness and upkeep. As we walked through their parking lot the smell of garbage was palpable and walking in is just clutter all around, the place is pretty small, brooms and cleaning items where at plain view of the clients  We decided to sit outside and it was not appealing at all  the owners should invest some money here, this a pretty decent area by Dilworth. Anyhow please try the place you may like it.
Great neighborhood bar, the beef on weck is solid and the wings are as good as any I have ever had. Very happy with the customer service and will definitely be back next time I am in the area.

I have now been to Lebowski's twice for trivia on Tuesday night and I've become a huge fan. It is really a great neighborhood bar and doesn't disappoint on food or drink specials. First time around I ordered the Haddock Fish Fry and was impressed at how delicious it was. The seasoned fries were delicious, the fried haddock was crunchy and flaky, and the homemade tartar sauce was just outstanding.  Big shout-out to the wings, which I got on my second visit. They really sauce them up and they are fried to perfection. The drink specials are great too, with $4 white russians every single day (and they are damn tasty) and $3 Fat Tire pints on Tuesdays.  This is a great establishment. Don't miss out on the awesome food and drink specials!

This restaurant was really good! It was my first time and I called in my order and Stephanie answered and I had no idea what I was getting but she was so patient and nice ! The food was amazing also! I will be eating there again!! The goldrush sauce is absolutely amazing and the customer service was awesome also! This is a great place to eat !

Lebowski's is the perfect local neighborhood joint if you want simple american food that is always delicious. This place has a nice atmosphere and felt very cozy. Our waitress was great and was very attentive. I got the wings since i had heard a lot about them and being from the north i was craving simple buffalo wings. They were perfect. Sometimes with buffalo wings they can end up being slimy but these had the perfect amount of the Mild Buffalo sauce to give them a kick but to not overwhelm me. While i was perfectly happy with the basket of 6 wings my dad opted for 10 and finished them all off. I guess it depends on how hungry you are and what you get for a side. While my dad got the garlic fries, which are DELICIOUS, i got the mac & cheese with pecan bacon, because bacon is everything. My mom went for the junior Haddock Fish fry which was amazing as well. Lebowski's is definitely on the top of my list now when i want some great all american food for a great price! YUM!

A very solid 3.5 ...  Atmosphere- My mom would hate it because it is a bit older and has a mildew(y)  scent. I on the other hand see it as eclectic...they had some Bob Marley playing and of course The Dude plastered just about everywhere. The Sabres banner didn't hurt either (I'm a UB grad ).  The bathroom was clean and overall the restaurant was tidy.   Food- I loved the B-lo touches. Franks, Sahlen's, Weber's...they've got it covered. I went with the Fredonia; a beef on weck of sorts served with horsey, melted provolone, au jus, pressed like a panini in a hoagie (sprinkled with caraway and coarse salt). I loved the au jus but I like my horsey straight on horseradish(y) aka much spicier. I will say their garlic fries were some of the best I've ever tasted. I splashed those suckers with malt vinegar and I was in heaven. My other half got a fish fry, he didn't seem too thrilled about it and he is pretty easy to please. He mistook the  beer bottle for the malt vinegar and still ate the fries though,that's how good they were!   Drinks- They had a special running that day, Monday $3 bartender bottles choice (meaning the bartender chooses a new beer each time). They weren't Miller Lite's and we were able to give a little direction on our choice (We were given Pilsner Urquell and a Ranger IPA). No complaints in that department : )   Service- We had a younger gentleman serve us, and he did a great job. He was very upbeat and friendly. The food came out super-fast (like how'd they do that ? fast)   Just a tip, they have another Monday deal two burgers for $10, I'm sure we'll return to get some of those with plenty of the delicious garlic fries.

I visited here for the first time today. I was veeery  impressed with the taste of the food but disappointed with the small amount of fries they offered for free with the  Yelp coupon .  The meal was still a little pricy. I only ordered a Haddock fish sandwich w/ garlic fries and the total was  $9 and remember the fries were free. I'll definitely visit again but for dinner instead of lunch.

First... Let me just clear it up and say... the BEST Buffalo Wings in Charlotte, NC.  This is a great place to go for dinner, lunch, a quick bite, for bar setting, and for us... football.  This is owned by Buffalo NY natives and keeps true to the tradition of Buffalo.  I don't now of a better Beef on Weck in NC than at Lebowski's.    We were lucky last season when our Chicago Bears played a ton of 4pm games after the Bills.  If you are a Bills fan, there is no better place to be on a Sunday.    We also would recommend the Veggie Pita (which we get in a wrap vs the pita) and the burgers.  Monday is 2 burgers for $10 and 1/2 off wine.  Killer deal.  I believe Wednesday is 1/2 off wings.  Salads are also very good.  Becoming one of our very favorite bars in Charlotte.

This place is no frills for sure. In a good way. We were looking for somewhere to watch some March Madness and decided we should go to the place that claims to have the best wings in Charlotte. Crowded on a Friday night and we had to wait a little for a table. They have a good bottle/can selection and a whole menu of white russians (of course).   I could have thrown a dart at the menu and been happy with whatever the outcome was. Everything sounded good.   Being there for the duration of the game, we started with wings. Yep, they are good. I loved the hot buffalo sauce, thought the garlic parm dry rub was a little boring. The blue cheese dressing is very good, you can tell its homemade. We also got a small order of the buffalo chicken nachos. Not my favorite since there wasn't any melty cheese to keep the toppings on the chips.   But the crispy haddock. Wow. I would never think to order fish and chips in a restaurant, but I kept seeing everyone's plates come out and it looked amazing. Definitely the best fried fish I have ever had. The tarter sauce it comes with is great and the garlic fries are a must-get! Also split the roast beef on weck. It was really good, I loaded mine up with the horsey sauce.   My only regret is not saving room for a white russian. We enjoyed our meal so much we went back to watch the Sunday game too!   They have great daily food specials and a lot of combination plates when you cant decide what you want. You can even get a combo with fish, a beef on weck slider and 6 wings! Best of everything.

Lebowski's isn't really the type of place that I'd normally stop at, for a couple of reasons.  First and foremost, because I don't get down East Boulevard very often (though I should - more and more places are cropping up that make it interesting).  Secondly, because it's a smallish place that looks a bit more like a pub than a grill, and in my advancing years it's just not where I'd stop for a bite to eat, which is what I'm more after these days than a drink.  That out of the way, when we had an unofficial Yelp gathering the other evening, I'm glad that it was chosen to be at Lebowski's, or we might have missed this hidden gem.  The night started off right with the service.  Amy greeted us right away (well, after Dave S. and Joseph L, but they don't really count, as they aren't employees), introducing herself, asking our names and perhaps most impressively, using our names throughout the time we were there.  Not often that you see that happen these days.  Nicely done!  That was followed up by a creative menu, serving the aforementioned sliders so that you aren't cornered into a single choice that you might not like.  I chose the beef on weck, burger and pulled pork.  They arrived with an impressive array of condiments, but those were scarcely needed - the sliders stood well on their own.  The weck roll doesn't seem to be quite an authentic weck roll, but I'm not an expert, and it serves the purpose well enough.  I probably could have done with another order of sliders, but I saved the extra room for one of the several varieties of White Russians (hey - a place called Lebowski's, and you aren't going to order a White Russian?).  Altogether a pleasant experience, and I'm glad we made the choice.  Parking was also ample, which can be an issue in this area of town.  The only downside is that it's not a larger space (that, and for some I could see it being more bar-like may be an issue).  For our group neither was a problem, but I could see where one might be for others.  I also wish that I had ordered the garlic fries instead of the mac and cheese as a side.  Very tasty (I sampled someone else's)...

I have been wanting to try this place for a while! We decided to go one night and got sat right away. Restaurant isn't huge or fancy but that's ok because it's locally owned and operated. Our server was awesome! She answered all our questions and she was super friendly!!  I got the 6 wing meal with garlic fries and a weck slider. Wings were awesome. I got it in hot buffalo with a side of ranch. Garlic fries were awesome! Super crispy and not greasy at all! Weck slider was good. Perfect amount! My husband got the grilled chicken sandwich and rice and he really liked it but he really loved my wings. We had no leftovers! I can't wait to go back! I'm gonna get the same thing but try a different slider!

The sweet potato tots are a must have when choosing a side, thanks in part to the delicious creamy cinnamon dip that accompany them. Pulled pork BBQ sandwich and stingers wings were also delicious! Great, relaxed atmosphere and extensive drink menu.
Don't come on Tuesdays. They reserve the whole restaurant for trivia with only reservations.

If your hands are showing their age and you want that smoothness back, order the fried pickles. They are delicious and so salty, my hands still look like a teenagers' again (#cheatdayperk).  We were regulars at the old Township Grill in Matthews so we're already biased to like this place. Plus, I'm married to a Yankee from around Buffalo so we are always up for wings and weck!  Kids came with us this time, they're finally getting into wings (#parentingdoneright) and we needed some weck.  Sunday at 615p, it was busy but not crazy, we had a table in just a few minutes.  Love the decor, because i love The Dude.  DH and I had the wings and weck, which was good. The weck was not piled high like it used to be, maybe they sensed that portion control is not one of my strong suits? Still tender and amazing. I had the Spots (sweet potato tots, yes i had to ask) which were fine but a small portion.  Kiddos had wings and fries.  It was health food at its finest.  We'll come back on date night for White Russians and that awesome beer menu.  They run specials all week so check it out.  Plus, it's not a chain. #extracredit.
WE loved this place.  The food was great and the service was brisk and friendly.  I will be back!

Always awesome! Kiel, Lizzy and Thomas treat you like family, even if it's your first time at Lebowskis!   Best wings and drinks in Charlotte!   Become a regular after one visit and you'll understand.   SERIOUSLY!!!

Determined to shake up our Saturday lunch routine, hubs and I stopped by Lebowski's to try their famous wings and take in a bit of college football in the mean time.   The first impression is a bit nondescript - Lebowski's looks like many other sports bars in Charlotte and has a nice little patio facing East Blvd. Because Mother Nature gave us a break from the 90s, we chose to sit outside and enjoy a relaxing lunch (hubs was especially happy as there are TVs outside, too!). Both the hostess and our server weren't the cheeriest of individuals...it seemed like they both had a long night out. Regardless, hubs went with the Carolina Gold wings and the Beef on Weck, I choose a side salad and the small version of the Chili & Mac 'n Cheese.   Upon ordering our server informs us that the wings take about 15-20 minutes to cook. Um...ok...that's a little odd, but we would still like them. This was noon on a Saturday in a not-so-busy restaurants. Now, I'm not a wing eater but even hubs said that that's a long time to wait for six wings. So, basically the entire time we were joking with each other that the cook had to go fetch the chickens and take care of them so he could have his wings in less than 20 minutes.   And yes, it did take 20 minutes for these wings to reach our table. I'll let hubs review his own food. As for mine...the salad was fresh but not too much to report. Their side salad included bits of iceberg and romaine, a flat crostini and a few other veggies.   As for my Chili Mac 'n Cheese, it was pretty tasty albeit the chili was a bit sweet. I had a different expectation...when I saw a cup of chili mac 'n cheese I expected a cup of chili with a bit of mac 'n cheese at the bottom. I was a bit suprised when I saw a flat dish of mac 'n cheese with a small scoop of chili on top. No worries, though, I ate it up - it was a nice little serving.   Will I be back to Lebowski's? Sure...for a few beers and maybe a snack, but I don't think it's going to make it into my trusty lunch spot list.

Only been once, before moving to Alabama for school.   It took awhile for us it get a table, and when did, it was on the patio, which was crammed up feeling since we had 3 people sitting at a 2 person table.    The food was really good, I think I ordered the E-Street as my memory serves me right. Had that with OMB Copper. Love the location, besides finding a parking spot, but that can be anywhere on East blvd.

I LOVE the wings here, unfortunately, I don't love the pricing structure and enforcement of it.  I had first visited a few years back when searching for a great wing restaurant (ECW has some delicious and interesting flavours but doesn't always deliver on quality and doesn't hit the basic Buffalo flavour too well) in the Charlotte area. I entered the establishment on a crowded weekend night, and saw that it was full, so I approached the hostess. I told her that I wanted place an order for two 10 pieces to go and she offered that the 25 wing order that was cheaper than two-ten pieces.  I took her up on the offer and in the meantime decided to eat my wings there (minimal service, which was to be expected on a carry-out changed dine-in).  All was well said and done.  I have ordered take-out on several other occasions and everything has been great.  This past Sunday I had promised to take my Mom to experience her best "Buffalo Wings" experience yet; Stateside outside of Buffalo. We arrived, navigated the difficult and misleading parking lot, and walked in, to be greeted by the typical [upfront] friendly service and seated within minutes.  We were quickly seated but then after 10 minutes, several employees started to look concerned and started asking if our drink order had been taken yet (it hadn't), and going off to find other employees to rectify it.  Finally someone offered to take our drink order at the outside patio (a water and an unsweet tea) and said that if she had to, she could take our food order.  I was introducing my Mother to the "deliciousness of the wings from Lebowskis" as I had learned to love them which meant I needed a 25 wing order to fulfill the duty of my eating them along with my Mom (we ended up eating 7/7 of a 10/10 order).  She loved them but the fact that a wing restaurant can't cater to special wing orders (such as the 25 wings for $20 for a middle aged lady and her son) speaks volumes about the mindset of the owner.  i started this review as five-stars, briefly dropped it to four, and then got angry about how the establishment doesn't exercise discretion amongst its patrons (aka a Mom and Son couple is different than 12 frat 'bros' when ordering wings)...  Discretion is key and it lacks here, but the food is delicious...

So, on most days I have to fight myself not to drive here and get wings. Great, now I want wings. *forces self to stay in chair and write review*  This is such a great neighborhood bar. Completely laid back. And if you're from Buffalo, you'll fall even more love with this place. You'll find things like Beef on 'Weck and chicken finger subs on the menu. They're a Bills backer bar.   Lebowski's has a ton of daily specials. Lunch, dinner, drinks. They even do a twice a day happy hour. On Wednesdays, wings are half price all day. My favorites are the gold rush and good ole buffalo style sauces. Ton of burger and chicken sandwich options on the menu. I love that there's a slider nation section with a combi-nation: six wings, one slider, and fries for $11.95. The garlic fries are delicious.   Other odds and ends: Trivia on Tuesday nights. The patio is dog-friendly. House White Russians are four bucks every day. The parking lot is a little awkward and can get crowded.  So, who wants to go eat wings now?

"You're not wrong Walter..."  Tonight was my group's second trip to Lebowski's for trivia and we had sort of a... weird night.  I can't really be angry.  The buffalo wings were excellent.  The staff was friendly.  But man...  Trivia starts at 8, we get there at 7:45.  There were several groups milling around and the hostess looked a little frazzled.  She took our name, maybe a few groups ahead of us.  As we're waiting more and more people are showing up and being seated from a reservation book.  Did you know Lebowski's took reservations?  I wouldn't even think about it but I can accept that trivia is popular.  One of the reasons I was interested in the place is my brother has been to trivia dozens of times - never heard of the reservation book.  Well we waited, and waited.  We were offered a table outside but my friends turned it down.  The thing that irritated me, and I'm sure this is something you fixate on when you're waiting to be seated but - For nearly an hour a group sat with their check on their table.  As near as I could tell, and I was staring them down like a complete weirdo, no staff came by to hurry them along.  They weren't playing trivia and it was a packed house.  We were standing up playing.  We finally snagged a table, not the one I was obsessing over.  Those folks stayed over an hour after having finished.  We decided to go ahead and leave after eating.  We missed getting our question sheet for the second round amidst the hubbub of getting seated.  So a lot of this isn't Lebowski's fault but I really felt like whoever is behind restaurant karma wasn't on our side tonight.  If I was with someone lingering that bad at the table I'd just leave them there.

I love this place!!! The food is always good and they had a load of options. My favorite things on the menu were the Tuscan Turkey Burger and the Spot Tots. The Tuscan style is no longer on the menu but you are still able to order it. There were no complaints from me but my friends said they would pass on the Mac and Cheese next time.
Never knew I would like a sandwich so much! Food Tasted super fresh and the place has a simple and elegant ambience!

I have yet to have bad food here...Beef on Kimmewick, Mac and Cheese, Garlic Fries (but I like Mac and Cheese better).    They serve Becks and have trivia.  Pretty easy parking and great staff.  Nick is great.  Decent beer collection.  Want to catch trivia.    This is the kind of place that if I lived closer to it...I would be like Norm form Cheers...they would all know my name.
Probably the best buffalo bar in Charlotte...didn't know there were so many. Had the Lebowski burger and the food, like buffalo sport teams, was mediocre.

Went to Lebowski's for the first time last Friday. We were on the hunt for some good wings. We arrived a bit before the dinner rush (just after happy hour ended) and did not wait long for a table. The atmosphere inside Lebowski's reminds of my favorite neighborhood bar from Ft. Lauderdale; it looked to be filled with local regulars enjoying the end of their week.   Ordered the medium buffalo wings for an appetizer and they were the best part of our meal! I would like to try some of their other flavors next time. I ordered the two slider meal with the buffalo chicken sandwich and the cheeseburger, garlic fries as my side. The fries were amazing.   The sliders were much smaller than the waitress made them out to be (I had asked her how big they were). Normally a slider meal will come with 3-4 sliders at that size, but this one only had 2. For $3 more I could have ordered another slider, but still $10 for 3 small mediocre-tasting sliders is a bit much.   Our waitress was attentive and our beers were refilled in a timely manner. I would go back to try other wing flavors and for the fries.

Lebowski's is definitely a neighborhood place to grab a bite to eat and wash it down with alcohol. Thankfully it's walking distance from the hospital so my brother and I made our way there several times, one for lunch and another for dinner. It's one of his favorite places in the area.   Parking can be a challenge since the lot is small and parking hard to come by in the immediate vicinity on East Blvd. it also gets very crowded here. We opted to sit in the outdoor patio out front even when it was a little chilly since the inside is pretty cramped. Even though they have heat lamps outside we were told they can't use them since it's some sort of fire hazard. No biggie, I'm from Chicago so it didn't bother me. I preferred sitting outside since the inside smells a little like a wet damp cloth.  Both the hostess and staff are so friendly. Our server was kind enough to card us, which happened to be a few days after my birthday, bless her soul. Obviously I had to have a White Russian from their drink menu dedicated just to The Dude's quintessential drink. Both The Stranger and The Lebowski Caucasian hit the spot.  We tried the Trio Dip Platter which came with Spinach-Artichoke, Pimento Cheese, and Hummus, along with a good portion of pita points, crostini, and tortilla chips for dipping. It's a great way to start a meal and perfect for sharing since it can appeal to a variety of tastes. For entrees I had The Fredonia with the 'Weck (Kosher salt and caraway seeds) added to the grilled panini bread. It was so good. The roast beef and provolone with the accompany au ju was au so juicy. The 'Weck elevated it to the next level. Just the taste and crunch from the seeds added to the flavor land. texture profile. Also upped my side order to the garlic fries. They were good but not as crispy as I'd hoped. Brother had the Maude's Meatloaf which he's had before and said was great.  We went back for wing night during the week. The Garlic-Parm wings were great. The garlic fries were better this time around. Looking forward to the next visit when I'm back in the neighborhood.

We go here a lot with our office staff. The fish is so yummy! The service is usually slow but they are super nice and accommodating. Parking is a little weird but since we normally walk here, it isn't that big of a deal for me.
My first time here and I heard the wings were amazing so I tried them along with a burger. Shockingly I finished both! Food was amazing and the service was great. I will definitely be returning

Lots of beer selections and great bar food. Wings are crispy, good char, and tasty sauces. Also comes with good portion of celery, which is rare. And beef on a weck is stacked and my #1 get on the menu (with au jus)!

Great late-night option, or dinner!  Always our go to when we can't decide on dinner and it's 8 pm... the staff are friendly and attentive and all of the food is good.  Highly recommend the sweet potato tots as your side!  And they run great daily specials at the bar.   Also a great place to sit and watch a game!

We used to be big fans of Township Grill where the family started in Charlotte but don't get to East Blvd all that often. We happened to be in the area last night and stopped in and are we glad that we did.  There was plenty of parking and easy access from the road.  We were greeted warmly like they really cared that we were there. The atmosphere was just right for a neighborhood bar and grill.   Our server was super.  Just the right mix of efficient professionalism and friendly helpfulness.  She helped us select a couple of our favorites from the old days; The beef on a weck and the fish fry.  They are every bit as good as they ever were and maybe even a bit better. The portions were perfect for an evening meal.  The price was very reasonable. It took us a while to find our old friends but we will be back soon.
Just not a good experience. It's too bad. This is our second time trying this restaurant. With so much competition the food and service really needs to improve

This is my favorite bar in Charlotte, almost a dive bar but not really... The food here is great, and the service top notch. Good craft beer specials from the local breweries.  Lebowski's  has great wings and sandwiches alike. We are really fond of the Dilworth area.  Be sure to stop by.
Great Food! Period! The White Fish amazing and always fresh! Friends who have eaten here all have had a great experience.

Not bad, but not great. Husband had the bacon cheeseburger and it was cooked perfectly. Salad was fresh and green. My cheeseburger sliders were a bit dry, no extras (lettuce, tomato, onion, sauce, etc) - forgettable. Sweet potato tator tots were cooked correctly, but not much additional flavor to them to make them stand out. Service was excellent, hostess efficient and friendly. Restaurant was cold, so a bit uncomfortable. To be fair, the hostess tried to seat us at a high top table further in due to the cold, but we didn't want to "be on display" and asked to sit at a regular table. Pictures of other dishes on Yelp look good, so maybe I picked the outlier.
We've gone here twice, but each time it's so hot in there it's just too miserable to stay. How about getting that air conditioning fixed???

Lebowski's is ok, but not great.  The outdoor patio is nice and service was really good, but the food was uninspired.  The chili nachos had very little cheese - and it was that runny cheese-whizzy stuff.  The chili was also on the sweet side, and not to my taste. The burger was decently priced but overcooked.  The pulled pork dinner was a small pile of shredded pork on top of a huge pile of mac 'n cheese.  Unfortunately, the mac 'n cheese was also made with that runny cheese.  Portion sizes were decent, but when the food is not that great, what's the point?

I really like this place! I don't know why I don't stop by more. First time I headed over my friend and I sat on the patio and sipped on beers. Not a huge beer menu but think I've been spoiled by the places with 40 or so beers on tap. You can always take your chances with a 'mystery beer', which is really just whatever random beer they pull and charge you $2 for haha.   Last time I headed over was for lunch. Parking in the back can get tight and can be a challenge getting out as well so be prepared. But anywho, ended up getting a half-priced deal so headed over to meet a friend. I order the buffalo chicken wrap and my friend opted for the French dip and we both had side salads - it was all very delicious! Gotta say, I was happily surprised... I underestimated the quality of food at Lebowski's. And the service was prompt and friendly as well. A great spot in Dilworth to chill out at night and a speedy place to go for lunch as well - props to Lebowski's.

First time visit was yesterday for lunch. It was relaxing and tasty. I had the fried haddock and garlic fries (junior portion - generous serving) and it was incredibly tasty. Some if the best best fried fish I've eaten!  The garlic fries were divine. Substituted cinnamon apples for the slaw. Also tasty. My mother had the Angus beef burger and declared it delicious and perfectly cooked. Wait staff attentive and knowledgeable. Will return!

I am a wing fan of the most particular kind and these wings did not disappoint! Best wings ever! I had the house special sandwich, their version of the French Dip. The bread was to die for, horsey sauce was over the top! I got the side salad and I am telling you it was fresh, crisp and the freshly made dressing was perfect.  Patio seating, bar or table seating.

This tiny little eatery makes up in taste what it lacks in service. The food is worth the trip folks. I got a trio platter and tried the haddock, beef on weck, and the wings. The beef on weck is the clear winner here. What awesome flavor! They have great outdoor seating and allow dogs on the patio. The menu looks great, so I'm sure to be back to try something else (or just eat another beef on weck).
Excellent spot for lunch. Lebowski burger and Wooden Robot Overachiever pale ale are an awesome combination.
The food here is good. The service is quick.  The prices are reasonable. I like the environment because it is just comfortable and casual. I will definitely be back for a second try!

This place is a typical neighborhood pub however they have good food fully stocked bar and beers on tap. Usually a good crowd on weeknights and on weekends. They also have bar games. It's in a good location in Dilworth. This is not my favorite spot however good to revisit every now and then.

The E-Street pita is very tasty. The spot tots and the cinnamon butter is awesome. They are just very stingy with how many they give you compared to other restaurants . It was freezing and would not seat us outside . The fans were blowing my hair while I ate. Staff is friendly .

This has kind of become my boyfriend's and my after church stop! This unassuming place is not only delicious, but has something for everyone on the menu. Their haddock fish fry is out of this world, and it's the same fish they throw on their soft tacos, which is usually my go-to.   The beef on weck is also a popular choice and is served with a generous amount of fries (or any side for that matter). They also have "spot tots" which are sweet potato tater tots! Such an amazing taste!   I would highly recommend checking out this dude loving, buffalo supporting bar/restaurant in Dilworth if you have the chance, you won't be disappointed!
Great Neighborhood spot!  The chili is my favorite along with the great sandwiches.  Also, the Time magazine cover mirror in the ladies bathroom is hilarious.  The Dude Abides!

Pros: Great wings Great beef on Weck (best in Charlotte)  Cons: Bad parking The restaurant really needs to be updated, but I guess that's some of its charm.  Awful service. We waited almost 45 minutes before we got our sandwiches. They charge extra for au jus, which is just weird to me!  For Buffalo food, this place is great.

Awesome!  This is a great neighborhood restaurant/bar with patio seating and good service.  I typically order something new at places so I can try everything, but it is incredibly difficult to not order the wings, or at least the beef on weck.  I love the hot or jerkiyaki wings.  I try not to say that somewhere has the best anything, unless it is true... Lebowski's has the best wings you will get anywhere.  The owner, Kirk, is from Buffalo and he knows his stuff.  They cook the wings the right way, using fresh chicken wings and he puts them on the flat top to help crisp them up.  You won't be able to eat BW3 or any other crap wings ever again without comparing them to Lebowski's.

This place has arguably the best casual/bar food in the city. The wings are absolutely fantastic (medium buffalo ordered extra-crispy are our favorite), and the other items are always consistent. The beef on weck (with "horsey" sauce) and haddock fish fry will not disappoint. Try the signature Lebowski Caucasian White Russian from the bar as a nice change-up from your typical bar drinks.

With a Buffalo theme, you know the wings should be good. The wings are as good as advertised, game days are fun, kids have fun options and the staff is always friendly and helpful.   This is one of a our favorite places to take the whole family, and even the dogs can hang out on the outdoor patio.   If you are in the mood for beer, wings and a Beef on 'Weck, you need to take your crew here...

LOVE this restaurant! It's one of my regular spots now. All the servers I've had so far have all been GREAT!! They have some kind of fish dinner that is to-die-for. Big portions for the price you pay. I usually can't finish all of my fish, but I can't avoid stuffing myself from trying! I also usually get the "Bunny Toes" drink. It's like a mint-chocolate White Russian (has Bailey's mint chocolate in it). It's delicious!!

I wanted wings, that's the main reason we came here and it did not disappoint. They where perfectly cooked and the flavors where on point! Garlic parm & buffalo where our favorite. The hostess and waitress where very nice and attentive. The garlic fries where also great. Can't wait to come back and eat more wings!
