I found this place while searching for a good wing place. I must say I'm impressed! The wings were really good they were hot just like I like them! The waitress was extremely nice and even gave me a free brew on the house. For 10 wings and fries came up to $13.95 and that's not bad. I don't stay far from the dilworth area and have seen this place on Yelp but never tried it. I'm so glad I did! I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu. Thanks Lebowskis for making my day after a long hard work day!

Tuesday night is always hopping with trivia. If you want to bring a group for trivia you may want to call ahead so you can make sure to get a table big enough. First place is $30 and the winners of each round get 4 beers.  My favorite is the chicken tenders tossed in "stingers" sauce but pretty much anything on the eclectic menu is great. Haven't found anything that I've been remotely disappointed in after coming almost once a week for a year.
Had a late lunch with my Shmoopy. Meatloaf:Outstanding Beef weck:Yummo Return soon: Yea Dude

I wasn't really sure about this place at first.  With a Big Lebowski theme, you would expect more of a west coast vibe.  This place is all New York east coast atmosphere.  I had the Beef on weck, and it just didn't hit the spot.  The true star of my meal was the garlic fries.  I rarely eat fries anymore, but I'm pretty sure I get these guys every time I come here.  My hetero life mate had the Buffalo Trifecta.  The blackened wings were really bland.  We each tried one, and then never touched them again.  The fish was amazing.  That's what I'll be ordering next time I'm there.

Where do I start...friendly service from the moment the phone is answered and to me that's important. The food, OMGoodness the food, is beyond AMAZING! I can honestly say it's the best food I've had in a very long time (and my family orders takeout a lot) each time better than the time before. For anyone who loves pulled pork, their Memphis Style sandwich is nothing short of spectacular!!! Tender and juicy on grilled sourdough bread with pepper jack cheese, I didn't even know I liked pepper jack cheese, it's easily become my new favorite meal. Sandwiches come with chips but I spend the extra 99¢ for the cinnamon apples (the best I've ever tasted). My son loves the Lebowski burger which comes with roast beef and queso, quite the combination and not one I ever would've thought of but delicious! Definitely a place worth trying, repeatedly

My wife and I wanted to try a different sports bar in town, mainly because it  was Game 4 of the NBA Finals... we chose this bar because we'd heard people talk about it and we passed it frequently. Parking was "interesting", but we figured it out and the wait time for a Friday evening was pretty good (about 15 minutes). But from that point on, it was a DISASTER; we waited close to 20 minutes before anyone came by to even give us water or utensils (while every table around us was clearly being served appropriately). Once someone actually took our drink order, the wait staff FINALLY came over and attempted to take our order; the server was very fake and aloof and came off with the "why are you here?" attitude (we did notice that we were the ONLY people of color in the bar at the time) To give some credit, the food order did arrive quickly and the food itself was fair overall, but the service and the experience was the worst I've experienced in quite some time and we will don't be going back ever again!! I ABSOLUTELY DO NOT RECOMMEND IT FOR ANYONE OF COLOR... the disrespect was blatant and unapologetic...

Came in on a Friday and had their dinner special (Crispy Haddock Filet and homemade Crab Cake with Chili-Lime Aioli, fries and coleslaw) with a Stranger White Russian... Both were great choices, but the crab cake on the special could use a little something... Not sure what, but it didn't really blow me away...  The White Russian was insane... I haven't stopped thinking about it since... lol I'm kind of mad it took me this long to go here since I'm actually from Charlotte! lol
Best around for a friendly low key night out.  Great service, very solid bar food, and reasonable prices.  Great wings, fried fish and nachos.   Decent selection and a late night menu after 10pm.

Not just excellent bar food. Sure, the wings, nachos, fries, fried pickles are ALL excellent, but we go here just as much for the SUPERB fried haddock or the DELICIOUS, FRESH, & ORIGINAL SALADS!  Beyond that Lebowski's is family run & EVERY employee treats you like family.  Great weekly lunch and dinner specials, one of my favs is Wednesdays when wings are 1/2 off and bartenders pick of beer is just $3 (you give them yvour preference and they pick something in that wheelhouse ... FUN!).  You also can't beat a place that celebrates the classic The Big Lewbowski! Top it off, the white Russians and specialty white Russians are AWESOME (bunny toes and nutty Walter being my 2 favs)  Lebowski's gets my highest recommendation for the WHOLE PACKAGE ... the menu, the drinks, the atmosphere, the staff, and the attentiveness to bar fare done excellent!

Everything you could imagine bar wise in the menu food-wise especially a solid atmosphere without a hassle. Remember, it's called lebowskis named after a movie who featured a stoner who took it easy and drank white Russians. If you're in a hurry or want fast food, go someplace else. Excellent mid to high end bar food and solid meals. No steaks or anything but great in a pinch when you want specials and drinks with friendly service. An old lady is bitching about her family for the last half hour at the bar right now which drives me nuts but this place takes all types. Roll the dice, order a house Caucasian after you smoke a bowl in the parking lot, and get some wings or a roast beef sandwich with a free side bc of the help app.  You're welcome.  I can listen to this retard crab about her shitty family to some guy with a "fupa" because this place is so cool.

I had lunch at Lebowski's on a Saturday.  I got there around 11:30 am and the place wasn't too full yet.  I had this on my list to try and the recent burger battle in the Observer had gotten me in the mood to try out some of the best burger spots.  I ordered a cheeseburger with pepper jack and the standard setup.  It comes with chips, but I opted for the fries for an extra $0.99.  The had a nice list of beers and I went with and OMB Copper.  My food & beer made it out pretty quickly.  When the server brought my food he also brought ketchup & mustard.  The ketchup was cold from the fridge, which I like, but that is unusual.  So a plus for cold ketchup.  The burger was done medium and was juicy.  The lettuce and tomato were fresh.  The fries were crisp on the outside and creamy soft on the inside.  Overall a very nice burger an fries.  The best in Charlotte?  This was my first stop at a burger place so that remains to be seen.  The servers did a good job of helping each other.  Which was good because my server was "getting her butt kicked," as she put it when she checked back on me once.  I had to wait quite a while for my check and for her to run my credit card.   It was busy, but no where near being swamped.  That was unfortunate and I hope she was having a bad day.  The food was a 4 the service was a 2 so I have to give them 3 stars.  I will try Lebowski's again just to see if that was a bad day or par for the course.
Found this spot on yelp, Lebowski's didn't disappoint. Everything was good and fresh. The service was friendly and fast. I would recommend and definitely return.

We were at Lebowski's a few months back for a few beers and we were impressed with the sincerity of the bartender, so now we live in Charlotte and we had to go back for food and we were not disappointed. Wings with sweet honey chili sauce were nice and crispy, needed no Blue Cheese or any other sauce. PLT sandwich (Pimiento, Lettuce and Cheese) was great. I had the burger with Pimiento and onion rings, it was phenomenal, as were the garlic fries.  My only concern was that it seemed that the bathroom walls and ads behind the urinal hadn't been cleaned in a long time, they looked very dusty. Overall, I will be back often!

Went to Lebowskis last week for dinner. The food and service were outstanding! I had the Haddock fish fry which was crisp on the outside and seasoned just right. My companion had the roast beef panini which he liked very much and my other friend's burger was cooked to perfection. Great beer selection. We didn't try the White Russians but they sounded delicious.  We lingered after dinner to talk and made to feel right at home. A real Buffalo treat in the heart of the south!

I would have to say dining here was a mediocre food and service experience.  Staff seemed friendly enough but they often disappeared for extended periods of time. We ordered hot buffalo wings for an appetizer which would be the best part of the dining experience at Lebowski's. Not overly spicy to where you cannot eat them but delivered a little kick with nice flavor.   Following the wings I ordered Durango Chicken. This dish was cooked well but left something to be desired in flavor. My other half ordered the Boss Grilled Turkey Club with side of mac and cheese. He states it was a mediocre sandwich, nothing that impressed him. Mac and cheese not as cheesy or creamy as one would want, but flavor is "alright".  Tables are exceptionally close to each other, so if you want any privacy or are trying to choose a place that welcomes long stays and good conversation, look on to other places to better fit your needs.   If you need a little positive note to end the review on, Lebowski's has a nice beer selection and they come out ice cold which is always appreciated.

Being from Buffalo, this felt like home.   When I go to the grocery store and ask for au jous at the deli counter they think I am nuts, but here they make that beef on weck.    They also have a real fish fry!     All nostalgia aside, food is good, but it is also kind of a typical bar.    Good place to have some fun and a casual meal.

Me: Wellp. It's getting too late to run to the store to get stuff to grill, want to go out? Lady: Everything is going to have a long wait by now! 7:30 on a Saturday?  Me: Can we at least try something? I have a place bookmarked. Casual place, shouldn't be any problem getting in.   And we didn't. And it was a really good Saturday night dinner. This was our first time here and sure as hell won't be our last. First of all, I can't commend the staff enough. The friendliest bunch of people will do anything to give you recommendations or suggestions. The food was great as well! I got their pimento burger with garlic fries (which I really really recommend), and the lady ordered the Mission Bay Salad (with the added haddock and dressing), not to be missed. I can't wait to go back and try out more of their offerings, especially their wings and Beef on 'Weck. (I know, I should've ordered this the first time I came, but that's what second chances are for, right?)

If you're looking for an upscale dining experience, look elsewhere.  If you're looking for a comfortable neighborhood bar that focuses on the food and a unique atmosphere go here.  I've been searching for great wings in Charlotte for years and I've found them.  They do them the buffalo way and they are delicious.  The beers were cold and the staff was friendly.  The owner and his daughter were behind the bar and were very friendly and conversational, if you like that kind of thing.  I got french fries with my wings and they were on point.  The blue cheese was over seasoned and not enough crumbles for my liking, but still enjoyable.  I would give this place 5 stars, but the only thing they're lacking is their TV situation for sports.  I scratched my head when I heard that it's the biggest Bills bar in the Carolinas when I saw they only have two small out dated TV's behind the bar.  Nevertheless, next time I have friends in town and we're in the mood for wings, I'm taking them to Lebowski's  The owner told me the meatloaf is worth coming back as well so I'll try that next time.

I don't know why I wasn't expecting much considering the raving reviews, but this place really made an impression on me! It's definitely a cozy neighborhood bar type of place. The waitress was very friendly as was everyone on the staff.   We started with the wings for an appetizer and our waitress suggested getting the "gold rush" flavor. It was like a mustard based sauce with some heat to it. They were delicious! I would recommend the gold rush wings to anyone. For dinner I had the meatloaf and it was very tasty. The gravy had lots of great flavor and it was a ton of food. My only negative was that the veggies were too oily. My lips were coated in oil. Other than that very good. My husband got the beef of weck sandwich and it was ok. I didn't prefer it because the bun was covered in rye, but the beef was ok. Overall, I would definitely come back!

We had originally planned to go the the Cheesecake Factory, we waited about two hours and still didn't get a table then; we went to bad daddy's burger bar. It was crazy they told us It would be about an hour so we decided to try this place. This was by far one of my favorite restaurants of all time! I can say the blew bad daddy's out of the water!!!! I've been a vegetarian for almost 16 years and really the only thing I can find out to eat is veggie burgers. You could substitute about any chicken or meat on the menu for hot Buffalo Cauliflower Bites. I had a buffalo cauliflower wrap and It was my favorite food of all time! My husband loved the wrap and he's a meat eater. Our waitress was so nice and It was a very relaxing spot. We ate outside and It was quiet and we could actually talk and enjoy ourselves! I can't wait to go back. We live about an hour away but It worth the drive and the prices are great too. I am so glad we found this place.

My go-to late night spot! They have great drink specials (try the White Russians!!) consistently good food, and the atmosphere is relaxed and friendly. The late night menu has options for meat eaters and vegetarians, so I find something for every mood. Plus, it's a local business and the waitstaff are efficient and always ready with a recommendation! Highly recommend.

Yay Friday!  After a long haul, my man and I wanted to celebrate the best night of the week.  We put our name in for a table and approached the bar.  The bartender immediately acknowledged, even though she was mixing a drink.  Talk about multitasking! We were seated fairly soon after getting drinks from the bar.  I ordered the veggie burger with pimento cheese and onion rings, no bun.  With fries.  Very pleased with the delightful tastes.  My honey  got haddock sliders and Mac and cheese.  He also liked his meal, although he prefers his Mac to have baked on cheese instead of mere creaminess. The really outstanding feature of Lebowski's is the staff.  Nobody acts "too cool" like some of the young, hipster hosts and servers at other establishments.  Everyone projected a sincere attitude of happy and upbeat.  They were on it with their service. TGIF indeed!

Once again Yelp comes through!!!  Lebowski's is GREAT. Small and cozy with good games on the TV. The wigs are where it's at. I had the Jerkiyaki and there were perfect. The Blue Cheese is on point and the Yuengling was nice and cold. I would have given 5 stars but the Yuengling wasn't on top!!! 10 wings and a beer for $16.00.

If you love roast beef, you must have the beef on weck! What a great sandwich. I thought about giving this place 3 stars but I thought harder and I feel it deserves 4. The wings are probably my favorite in the Charlotte area, in fact, this is the only place that I crave wings from.  The beef on weck was amazing.  I wanted to try something different so I had the chicken sandwich, jerk style because the waitress confirmed that it was really good and my husband had the Fredonia Dip.  I did not enjoy the "jerk style" on my chicken sandwich, although the chicken was fine.  My husband said his Fredonia dip was good but not as good as the Beef of Weck.  Overall, the food is great.  Oh...did I mention the garlic fries?  Those are yummy too!  A great place to hang out for lunch, everyone is friendly and it has a great patio with a TV to watch football!  I think I might stop by for a beer one night too since it has a cute little bar - but be warned, it's not big and doesn't have a lot of stools.

It is pretty hard not to be a fan of Lebowski's.  I mean it really is the perfect "neighborhood" grill.  Great atmosphere, low key, lots of options, affordable prices, great location, etc.  You really can't go wrong.  We had a party of 10 on a Saturday night and we were seated quickly, served promptly and efficiently.  We started with the fried pickles which were okay but a little too salty.  The ranch dressing was yummy though.  Everyone got something different...some burgers, some wraps, some salad, some wings, etc.  I tried the veggie burger in a pita wrap and it was great!  The sweet potato tots with honey butter dip were amazing.  It is pretty hard to go wrong with that but they really were excellent.  We weren't offered dessert so I have no idea if they have a good dessert menu but everything else hit the spot.  The pimento cheeseburger was a crowd favorite as well.  Truly there is something for everyone, healthy or greasy.  Great spot to catch a game, have a low key date night or to bring a group of friends.  I'll be back!!
First time here. Great selection of sandwiches we haven't had since moving down from Buffalo, NY. Waitress was great and made it a great experience

Dudes, Without a doubt, this is one of the best bar and grills I have ever been to. I should say I came here while in town for a conference and because I am a fan of the movie. However, it could have been a niche/theme restaurant only if it weren't for the great food and excellent service. The wings are great-I like them extra hot and these are not but they taste great. Sliders were wonderful. Beer selection proud and reasonably priced. A variety of White Russian specials (Caucasians) that were tasty too. The place is decorated with some original TBL themes art-some of which they were willing to sell. Amy was our server on both visits and she was one of the best servers I've ever had in a restaurant and went above and beyond for us. I would go back as a fan of the Dude if it wasn't good-but if they completely dropped the theme i would still be back any chance I got for the food and service. I just wish I lived closer.

I am embarrassed to admit I have never been to Lebwoski's...but, that is about to change. Last night we decided to check it out for dinner. After walking in all I could think about was the seafood/sushi restaurant that was in this same locations YEARS ago. So, with that in mind I was surprised how dark the restaurant was, and a lot more casual.  There are several TVs, a bar along the back wall and several tables throughout. But, the highlight is the outdoor patio. Have never been and heard great things about so many menu options we ordered a varity of items, including, wings, haddock, beef on weck, mashed potatoes and gravy and salad.  First off, the salad was simple, but very fresh. As for the wings, the best I have had in Charlotte. We got medium heat and it was perfect for my liking.  The haddock, OMG, loved it!  Great white fish with a light batter and a flavorful tartar sauce. My least favor item was the weck on beef. That may be because I am not a huge beef eater, but I thought it was just okay. And, they forgot our au jus so that may have helped. Overall great service, food and we will definitely be back.

The place could use an update, but I guess it has character. Best margaritas ever, and you can't beat their BBQ platter, or burgers. I've honestly never had a bad experience here. Staff is super friendly and I like that they take the time to talk to you. Never feel rushed, and patio seating is perfect for summer time weather, because it's in the shade!

It is what it looks like - a great place of beer, (excellent) bar/pub food, and hanging with fun, neighborhood people. I have been a number of times at all times of day - but mostly for lunch or evening during the week. Always excellent fare - especially the wings and burgers. I loved sitting outside recently - something I usually don't get to do. It is not pretentious and just does the simple things very well. Always kind and courteous and willing to give some great suggestions for drinks. Go and give it a try.

One of our favorite places in Charlotte. Been here about 10 times.  My wife loves the Weck - and has never been disappointed. She loves it. I've gotten the burgers and fish and they've always been good. We always pay a little extra to get the fries (worth it). The service has always been top notch.  Nice neighborhood feel with older and younger couples; families and folks just hanging out.  The parking lot is small and a little tricky. But that's the worst thing I can say. Everyone should try Lebowski's at least once.

I've never written a review before but I had to here. Although the entrees were good, the fried pickles were sooo salty!! It was like eating a salt lick. I wouldn't have been upset but after mentioning it to the waiter, who was nice but not very attentive, said he would let the kitchen know but never refunded me!! We didn't even eat them so it was obvious!!! Not to mention, they charge you for sides, the price on the sandwiches are expensive, then add an additional charge for a side. They ask you what side you want without mentioning it will be extra, you would assume the sandwiches would come with a side since the prices are high. I also waited 15 minutes to ask for ketchup so I got some myself from another table. I feel the owners are greedy. Not coming back
Comfortable atmosphere and very nice staff but neither the wings nor the Beef on Weck were anywhere near the true Buffalo standards.

Good local spot for a quick bite & drinks. Solid good food. This place was semi-forgotten by me until recently, once on a "snow" day and another time on a late Sunday night. For the most part, you can always count on this place being open and serving food.   I'm a fan of the $4 house white russian - it's like dessert first, dinner later. For meal, both times I had their sliders combo - good meatloaf (next time I will ask for more gravy), great fried fish & okay chicken parm. Only downside is their side - only chips comes with sandwiches. Or you can pay extra for other side options (even fries). BUT - when you check in on Yelp, it has a Yelp offer for side order. They let me have the chili mac and it was delish and HUGE. I know everyone loves their wings here - they are ok in my book, small in size, pretty hot for mild buffalo, and generally speaking I think their other food offerings are more satisfying.  Limited parking behind the building. so good luck.  Way to go Lebowski for keeping up the good work all these years!

Returning to this classic after entirely too long, I met a friend here for lunch today. Wow, it hasn't changed much since then. Perhaps a few more "Big Lebowsky" trinkets from the movie (I liked the Lego "picture") and updated furniture.  I went right to the "The Lebowski Burger" which comes topped with sliced roast beef and queso on a 'Weck roll'. Swapping out the chips for fries, it was excellent. Lots of meat, of course. Drippy cheese. Fries were "steak fries" variety and seasoned. Tasty and firm for scooping ketchup.  Good selection of beers on tap.

This place is amazing. I like to sample different things on the menu if it's my first time going to a place. The ambiance is cool! I took the little ones with me as well so it is definitely kid friendly. I had the large haddock platter and this fish is huge!!! So come hungry. I also ordered the haddock slider, honey butter chicken slider, and 1 buffalo cauliflower taco. Everything was amazing! No complaints! My daughter had the burger sliders and my son had the grill cheese...

I came to Lebowski's randomly with a friend. Parking (as with most of Dilworth) can be quite a bear. They have a parking lot, but it's really tight. I like that there is a patio, so that is nice to sit outside. Overall, the food was okay. I really enjoyed the sweet potato tater tots. Other than that, I wasn't super impressed with the food. It's a nice place to hang out with a lot of TVs, so good for watching games.  Another big perk was they allowed my dog to sit on the patio.
This place is chill. The service is fast and  courteous. The wings are good. The fried pickles are great. The weck is delicious.

3.5 stars   We stopped by Lebowski's for the first time yesterday for HH. I love the fact that Lebowski's have daily lunch and dinner specials on top of daily drink specials and HH two times a day from 4-6p and 10p-12a. There is also a fabulous Groupon deal right now, get on it! I don't like the fact that the parking lot is kind of a mess, very inconvenient that there isn't a second or larger exit. (Docked half a star.) We parked in the back but luckily were able to back out before running into trouble. There was Bills stuff everywhere! I'd love to watch a game here sometime, I'm sure they would have great specials.   Luckily, we were able to find a couple of bar seats right away as it wasn't as packed as I thought it would be at 5:45p. We ordered a couple of the $4 house White Russians which were $1 off...it was really strong at first but it tasted great..very comparable to melted Thrifty's ice cream..yum, my childhood. But beware, there is a TON of half and half in them, not diet friendly at all. We also ordered the spinach artichoke dip and tacos (1 chicken and 1 haddock). I enjoyed the spinach artichoke dip, tasted better than the dip offered at Crave. It also came with fresh tortilla chips and mini garlic toasts. I didn't like the tacos as much, there was way too much cabbage slaw that had a overpowering horseradishy/vinegary after taste. (Docked a star)The salsa was also on the sweet side but I didn't mind, I thought it went well with the fish. The chicken was well seasoned and juicy, I'd order this again and tell the server to have the kitchen go easy on the slaw.   Don't worry, I'm sure this rating will go up after I get my hands on the wings or battered fish plate. We will be back for more.

Great bar food, has it's own parking (although tight), which is a plus in this neighborhood.  My son had the Burger (Medium!) 4 Stars and Garlic fries (rockin!) 8 Stars :)  I had the Beef on Weck...which was probably the best I've had outside of Buffalo. 5 Stars  Wings were cooked great...not a big fan of their Hot Sauce...but could be a personal preference....would rate them 3.5 stars  Look forward to going back when I get to have a beer or two
Cool restaurant, especially if you are from western NY or a Big Lebowski fan. Good sandwiches and appetizer selection. Tues is trivia and 1/2 price specialty drinks.

I have to say I love gong to Lebowski's.  In fact I think I would love going to any place that was written up as having one of the best sandwiches in Charlotte, but this one really comes through.  A nice place, very inviting, small bar where I think everyone really could know your name.  but on to more urgent matters.  There are three words I am thrilled to hear upon walking into this place, besides "pick a table" and that is "BEEF ON WECK."  It in itself is worth the trip.  Roast beef sliced thin and piled high on a weck roll, fresh made roll with course salt and rye seeds, it is out of this world.  Before going to Buffalo way too often in the past I had never heard of Beef on Weck and once my wife and I decided to move to Charlotte I thought I would never hear of it again.  But I have to say Lebowski's offered it, I loved it and the rest is history.  I'll be back many times I'm sure and I would say everyone needs to try it at least once.

Been here a few times since moving to charlotte. Great food and service. Beer list is perfect for the restaurant. Very easy and layed back. The Beef on weck is a great choice. Wings also a good choice. Trivia on certin nights.
I came here for the sweet potato tots. Good wings and Meatloaf too! Nice place to hang out and good size parking lot for this location!

I was a little let down based on the great reviews I had read before going. I had the Fredonia dip since the regular Weck sounded kinda plain. I thought it was a decent sandwich but definitely nothing special. My husband had The Boss sandwich and was totally not impressed. Also, the people who were seated next to us after we had been there for 20 minutes got their food 5 minutes before us. We waited a long time for mediocre food. Meh.

Delicious meal at Lebowski's tonight! We had the fish fry and the beef on weck. Fish fry, great as usual. First time for the famous Beef on weck and not disappointed. Beef, bun, and horsey sauce were sublime. Good review for side house salad, blue cheese dressing, service, and tartar sauce .

Needed a quick meal before going to nursing school clinical's and boy did we get a delicious one!    I had the Beef on Weck.  Tender roast beef, piled high on a bun that's covered in salt, spices, and herbs.  It comes with a very rich flavorful au jus that you can't stop dipping into.  My side item was the Mac and Cheese with Pecan Bacon...absolutely scrumptious.  Like I said we were in a hurry and had to get over to the hospital but they were super fast with our order and everybody's was cooked perfectly.  Will be back and soon!!
Bland neighborhood joint.  Redeeming value:  some Lebowski art prints on the wall.  Otherwise burgerish joint with poor ambience.   Needs to be either classier or divier to be interesting.

I like Lebowski's.  A casual venue with a neighborhood feel to it.  I have never had a bad meal in the 10+ times I have been there.  Service is pleasant and courteous.  Food is a little better than what you would expect.  What is not to like?  But where is the kielbasa?

OMG I am embarrassed about my 2011 self that gave this place a 3-star review?!?  Usually now-a-days when I am thinking of what to go eat, Lebowski's is at the top of my list.  I apologize... maybe I gave it a lower star rating so that I would keep this place as my own little secret.  Just as a "downer" note, the parking lot in back does tend to get a bit crowded, but if you can walk to this spot, its ideal and you don't have to play bumper cars with the folks out back.  Everything else about this place is great!  Servers are super nice and top-notch.  Even when this place is super busy and they are running around like crazy, they make sure you got everything you need and are enjoying your experience.  Must-do's in this place:  garlic fries, beef on weck sandwhich (if you are into meat), WINGS!, and checking out the cool Lebowski artwork adoring the walls.

I had a Dealsaver coupon that was about to expire at the end of the month and I have lived near this place for several years and it's about time I checked it out.  I sat at the bar and this was one of the best bar experiences I've ever had.  The bartender explained the draft beer selection and their specials on Carolina Craft brews.  Yay!  4 of the locals were represented including Triple C.  :)    Anyway, i had seen the pictures of the food on Yelp and pretty much decided on what I was ordering from those - Fried Pickles and Beef on Weck.  The pickles were advertised as the "Best on the Blvd" and that's probably true.  I don't know of any other places on East Blvd that even serve them.  But the slices were big and they were decent.  I like Alexander Michael's better though.   The Beef on Weck was amazing.  The weck itself was the best sandwich bread I have ever tasted.   I ordered the garlic fries with it and they were tasty with a subtle garlic flavor.     As for the venue, it's not very big and I can see this as a great neighborhood bar.  Service really shines here too.  This place is definitely worth coming back to!

This place is absolutely the best! If you want the best wings in town, then this is the place for you. My husband and I were in the mood for chicken wings, so we decided to try Lebowski's. The place was crowded, so we sat in the parking lot and placed an order to go. We ordered 25 wings. They only allow you to get 3 type. We ordered the mild original, jerkiaki, and the carolina gold. The wings were cooked to perfection. The carolina gold were my favorite. I encourage any and all to try Lebowski's...you will not be disappointed.

Wings wings wings! Don't come here without trying the wings and I highly recommend the Gold Rush sauce. In addition to the wings we had the Beef on 'Weck, which was great but definitely need the au jus to go with it, and the tacos, which were plenty big for lunch. As a side item, try the Spot Tots which are sweet potato tots with a side of icing. Lastly, you can't go wrong with a wide array of beer. Our waitress was Brandy and she was the poster child for southern hospitality. Thanks Brandy!

My family had the BBQ wings and the On Weck Roast Beef. I had the pulled pork sandwich. Everyone enjoyed their meal. I didn't like the fries (garlic or plain). We sat outside and the atmosphere was great. Watched some football and relaxed!

I'm from Buffalo so I know wings and I have to say these are just like I would get back home- they are excellent!  The Beef on Weck is soooo good.  Has a relaxing chilled out atmosphere, never been disappointed here.

Stopped in on a Sunday night and was glad to see an almost packed restaurant. There were several TV's playing football games. We were seated and helped right away.  I ordered the Jerk burger, while my husband ordered a burger that had roast beef on top. The jerk burger had a really great taste and I enjoyed the toppings on it. I paid extra for fries instead of chips and noticed right away they were cooked to order. Some places serve fries that even though come out hot you can tell they have been sitting under a warmer. This was not the case at Lebowskis. My husband enjoyed his burger. First time having roast beef on top. He did say he wished there was more roast beef but the burger itself was pretty large. We also had a grilled cheese kids meal and a slider meal on our menu. I really loved how there was an option to mix and match sliders giving the option to try more than one kind. My children seldom finish their food and we always have left overs, this didn't happen dining at Lebowskis. Restaurant was kid friendly especially with the football game going on. The inside is slightly small so the tables are close together but my kids were really well behaved ( thank goodness) so this wasn't necessarily a problem.  Service was great, food was made  quickly and our drinks always remained full. Price was average for a family of four especially since the food was great. Will definitely return when in the area!

Should probably get your parking situation in order. There are 4 marked spaces behind the building. All others unmarked. Waitress kept coming out yelling at everyone trying to park in the unmarked spaces. Annoyed already and will never come to Lebowskis now.
